title: Daily Market Digest: Weekend Edition
subtitle: A summary of market activity for Friday, February 14, 2026

items.headline: U.S. Stocks Steady on Friday After Inflation Data, Nasdaq Edges Down
items.summary: U.S. equity markets closed a volatile week with major indices seeing minor movements on Friday, February 14, 2026. The S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average posted slight gains, while the Nasdaq Composite experienced a modest decline. The day's trading was influenced by an encouraging update on inflation, which showed consumer price index (CPI) falling to 2.4% in January, easing some concerns on Wall Street. The Federal Reserve maintained its neutral rate stance, while the ongoing discussion around the next Fed Chair also garnered attention. As markets are closed for the weekend, this digest reflects the closing data from Friday's trading session.

items.headline: Applied Materials Jumps on Strong Earnings and AI Outlook
items.summary: Applied Materials ($AMAT) rose significantly after reporting stronger-than-expected profit for the latest quarter. CEO Gary Dickerson attributed the performance to an 'acceleration of industry investments in AI computing.'

items.headline: Moderna Rises Following Better-Than-Expected Results
items.summary: Moderna shares climbed after the vaccine maker reported stronger results for its latest quarter than analysts had anticipated.

items.headline: DraftKings Falls as Revenue Forecast Disappoints
items.summary: Despite reporting a profit that topped analysts' expectations, DraftKings saw its shares drop after providing a revenue forecast for the year that fell short of market expectations.

items.headline: Nvidia Shares Decline Amid Market Shifts
items.summary: Nvidia ($NVDA), a significant force in the market, experienced a decline in its share price during Friday's session.

items.headline: January CPI Report Shows Inflation Slowdown
items.summary: An encouraging update on inflation was released on Friday, with the U.S. consumer price index (CPI) indicating a slowdown to 2.4% in January, lower than December's 2.7%. An underlying measure, closely watched by economists, also slowed to its least painful level in nearly five years.

items.headline: Kevin Warsh Nominated for Fed Chair as Powell's Term Nears End
items.summary: President Trump has nominated former Federal Reserve Governor Kevin Warsh to succeed Jerome Powell as the next Fed Chair. This development has driven Warsh's nomination odds to 96%. The Federal Reserve is also reviewing 'Matters Requiring Attention' issued to banks to align with a new supervision focus on material risk.

items.headline: Sector Rotation Sees Industrials Gaining Traction Amid AI Adoption
items.summary: Sector rotation continues to be a major theme in 2026, with the industrial sector benefiting from several long-term tailwinds, including lower interest rates, a rebounding manufacturing cycle, and the adoption of agentic AI. Small-cap sectors, particularly energy, materials, and industrials, have shown strong year-to-date performance.

items.headline: Major Earnings Reports on Deck for Next Week
items.summary: The upcoming week will feature earnings reports from several major companies, including Walmart, Airbus, Newmont, BHP, Palo Alto Networks, Booking Holdings, Analog Devices, Warner Bros, and Air Liquide.
